subscriptionChannels.title: Subscription Channels
subscriptionChannels.definition: Channel of subscription or cessation request can be CRM, SMS, USSD, or IVR.

enrollment.title: Enrollment
enrollment.description: Specify whether the existing customers can subscribe to this plan or not.
enrollment.definition: A plan can be restricted to port-in customers (coming from other operators), to new customers which includes port-in customers, to existing customers who have an account with Etisalat, or open to all customers whether they are new or existing.

fundPrerequisites.title: Fund Prerequisites
fundPrerequisites.description: Specify prerequisites for the provisioning action.
fundPrerequisites.definition: Pre-requisite conditions on the customer can be specified here.

captureFields.title: Capture Fields
captureFields.description: Specify additional fields that should be captured during provisioning (comma separated).
captureFields.definition: Additional Fields to capture during provisioning that are required for reporting or fulfillment reasons.

crmRoleName.title: CRM Role Name
crmRoleName.description: Specify required role name in order for the user to provision this service.
crmRoleName.definition: Only CRM users with certain access role can be limited to do the subscription of the product.

requestCommand.title: Request Command
requestCommand.description: Specify command and destination that the user should send for the request.
requestCommand.definition: Request of subscription or cessation should contain the request text and the destination which should process the text.

allowedMigrateInPlans.title: Allowed Migrate-in Plans
allowedMigrateInPlans.description: Specify plans that are allowed to migrate to this plan.
allowedMigrateInPlans.definition: Success Text will display a text informing the user that the subscription or cessation has happened successfully.
allowedMigrateInPlans.default: Your request to subscribe for <Service Name> was successfully processed.

successText.title: Success Text
successText.description: Specify message content to be shown to the user if the request has succeeded.
successText.definition: Success Text will display a text informing the user that the subscription or cessation has happened successfully.
successText.default: Your request to subscribe for <Service Name> was successfully processed.

failureText.title: Failure Text
failureText.description: Specify message content to be shown to the user if the request has failed.
failureText.definition: Failure Text will display a text informing the user that the subscription or cessation request has failed. It is important to include the failure reasons to the user that blocked the request otherwise the user might repeat the same request.
failureText.default: Your request to subscribe for <Service Name> was failed due to <failure reason>.

feedbackChannels.title: Feedback Channels
feedbackChannels.description: Specify channels for the success or failure feedback message.
feedbackChannels.definition: Customer can get confirmation feedback about the success or failure of the subscription request.

supportBulk.title: Support Bulk
supportBulk.description: Specify whether the request should be possible in Bulk screen.
supportBulk.definition: Bulk should be possible through online screen (max 50 accounts) or through file upload (max 5,000 accounts). In any case, the CRM user should get instant update on the progress of the bulk request and should get summary of the bulk request.

bulkFileFields.title: Bulk File Fields
bulkFileFields.description: Specify whether the request should be possible in Bulk screen.
bulkFileFields.definition: File containing bulk accounts should have certain fields to be processed correctly.

effectDate.title: Effect Date
effectDate.description: Specify when the activation should happen.
effectDate.definition: Service can be activated on later date than the subscription date.

addOnsMigration.definition: Unsubscribing from a base plan and then subscribe to another base plan (migration) can cause add-ons to be kept or removed.

durationType.title: Duration Type
durationType.description: Specify type of duration as day, week, month, quarter, or year.
durationType.definition: Contract can be specified as a duration type which can be day(s), week(s), month(s), quarter(s), or year(s).

durationAmount.title: Duration Amount
durationAmount.definition: Contract can be specified to lapse for certain amount of duration type.

autoRenew.title: Auto Renew
autoRenew.description: Specify whether the contract show automatically renew after completing the contract period.
autoRenew.definition: Contract can be set to automatically renew for the same contract period without customer involvement in which case the exit policy will be applicable again.

exitPolicy.title: Exit Policy
exitPolicy.description: Specify policy when exiting the contract before completing the contract period.
exitPolicy.definition: Exit policy can be: No Charge, One Month Charge, Monthly Charge x Remaining Months, One Fixed Charge, or Fixed Charge x Remaining Months.

fixedCharge.title: Fixed Charge
fixedCharge.definition: In case "One Fixed Charge" or "Fixed Charge x Remaining Months" is selected, then the fixed charge amount should be specified here.

notes.title: Notes
notes.description: Enter additional rules or information here.
notes.definition: Additional rules or information on Contract can be added here.

deviceSourceCost.title: Device Source Cost
deviceSourceCost.description: Specify initial device cost that will be used as base for calculations.
deviceSourceCost.definition: The original device cost (which doesn't include profit margin) or the retail cost (which includes profit margin) can be used as the base of the initial device cost.

maxAllowedCost.title: Max Allowed Cost
maxAllowedCost.description: Specify maximum device cost that can be sold to the customer.
maxAllowedCost.definition: The maximum device cost which can be provided to the customer can be restricted so that only devices below or equal the maxim allowed cost can be provided. This can be used to assure revenues as higher device costs can be riskier to recover its cost via indirect revenues.

deviceSubsidy.title: Device Subsidy
deviceSubsidy.description: Specify subsidy amount for the devices.
deviceSubsidy.definition: A device can be subsidized to reduce its cost so that it can attract customers to buy it. Usually, a subsidized device is provided as installments and bundled with other services.

calculationRoundUp.title: Calculation Round Up
calculationRoundUp.description: Specify round up of device calculation for nearest amount value.
calculationRoundUp.definition: Result of (Device Cost  Device Subsidy) / Contract Period can be rounded up to a decimal or whole number. For example, if 0 is specified, result will not be rounded (e.g. 12.23 --> 12.23). If 0.5 is specified, result will be rounded up to nearest 0.5 (e.g. 12.23 --> 12.50). If 2 is specified, result will be rounded up to nearest even number (e.g. 13.12 --> 14.00), and so on.

overflowAfterSubsidy.title: Overflow After Subsidy
overflowAfterSubsidy.description: Specify how to handle if the subsidy amount doesn't cover the device cost.
overflowAfterSubsidy.definition: In case the subsidy amount on the device doesn't cover its cost completely, then this can be handled in three different ways: spread this extra charge as periodic installments, post the extra charge as a one-time charge, or prevent the customer from taking the device when the subsidy cannot cover its cost.

deviceType.title: Device Type
deviceType.definition: Type of device denotes whether specific devices should be restricted for provisioning.

requiredDeviceTags.title: Required Device Tags
requiredDeviceTags.description: Specify required tags on the device so it becomes applicable. (Empty means any tag)
requiredDeviceTags.definition: Certain tags on the device can be used to restrict the allowed devices.

changeBasePlan.title: Change Base Plan
changeBasePlan.description: Specify what happens to device contract when the base plan flavor is changed.
changeBasePlan.definition: Specify the rule that should be applied when the base plan is upgraded or downgraded.
enum: Change Device Flavor to Match Base Plan

glCode.title: GL Code
glCode.description: Specify Finance GL code for this charge.
glCode.definition: GL (General Ledger) Code is used by Finance for revenue bookings.

serviceType.title: Service Type
serviceType.description: Specify services (Call/Message/Data) for which the usage should be inquired.
serviceType.definition: A single inquiry feedback message can contain information about the freebees consumption or tariff usage of Call, Message, or Data.

inquiryChannel.title: Inquiry Channel
inquiryChannel.description: Specify channel of communication that the user should use to inquire.
inquiryChannel.definition: Customer can initiate the inquiry by sending a text to USSD, SMS, or Email.

inquiryCommand.title: Inquiry Command
inquiryCommand.description: Specify command and destination that the user should send to get inquiry.
inquiryCommand.definition: Inquiry command should state the text that the customer should send for the inquiry and the destination which should process the inquiry request.

senderIdentifier.title: Sender Identifier
senderIdentifier.description: Specify SMS short code or Email address that will send the message reply of the inquiry.
senderIdentifier.definition: In case the "Inquiry Channel" is SMS, the short code of the sender is required. In case the "Inquiry Channel" is Email, the email address of the sender is required.

feedbackChannels.title: Feedback Channels
feedbackChannels.description: Specify channel of communication where the user will get the inquiry feedback.
feedbackChannels.definition: Inquiry feedback message can be send to the customer as USSD, SMS, or Email.

feedbackText.title: Feedback Text
feedbackText.description: Specify message content that user will receive in reply to the inquiry request.
feedbackText.definition: Feedback text can contain any characters but it should within characters limit if the channel is USSD or SMS. If special information should be included, then they should be included in curly braces such as {Remaining Call Freebees Amount} or {Expiry Date}.
feedbackText.default: Dear Etisalat customer, you have consumed all your freebees. To get more, contact Etisalat.

notes.title: Notes
notes.description: Enter additional information here.
notes.definition: Additional requirements on Inquiry property can be added here.

serviceType.title: Service Type
serviceType.description: Specify services (Call/Message/Data) for which the usage notification should be sent.
serviceType.definition: A single notification message can contain information about the freebees consumption or tariff usage of Call, Message, or Data.

notificationChannel.title: Notification Channel
notificationChannel.description: Specify channel of communication that the user will get the notification.
notificationChannel.definition: Notification message can be send to the customer as USSD, SMS, or Email.

senderIdentifier.title: Sender Identifier
senderIdentifier.description: Specify SMS short code or Email address that will send the notification.
senderIdentifier.definition: In case the "Notification Channel" is SMS, the short code of the sender is required. In case the "Notification Channel" is Email, the email address of the sender is required.

notificationEvent.title: Notification Event
notificationEvent.definition: Notification Event specifies the condition that triggers the sending of the message to the customer.
options: Freebees 60% Reached, Freebees 80% Reached, Freebees 100% Reached
Freebees 80% Reached, Freebees 90% Reached, Freebees 100% Reached

eventValue.title: Event Value
eventValue.description: Specify numeric value for notification event.
eventValue.definition: For certain Notification Events, another value need to be specified.

notificationText.title: Notification Text
notificationText.description: Specify message content that will be sent to user for the first usage notification.
notificationText.definition: Notification text can contain any characters but it should within characters limit if the channel is USSD or SMS. If special information should be included, then they should be included in curly braces such as {Remaining Call Freebees Amount} or {Expiry Date}.
notificationText.default: Dear Etisalat customer, your freebees consumption is started.

prompt.title: Prompt
prompt.description: Specify user prompt of the custom property.
prompt.definition: Text in the prompt can be used to display some information to the user.

type.title: Type
type.description: Specify type of the value of the custom property.
type.definition: Value type of the custom rule can be defined so that value input can be restricted. Supported types are: String, Number, Date, Currency, Boolean, Fixed List, and Variable List.

format.title: Format
format.description: Specify formatting of the value of the custom property.
format.definition: Format of the value can affect its appearance especially for numeric values. For example a date value can be formatted as "ddd dd-MMM-YYYY".

value.title: Value
value.description: Specify value of the custom property.
value.definition: Value of the custom rule can be predefined or it can be left blank.

definition.title: Definition
definition.description: Specify definition of the custom property.
definition.definition: Text in the definition can be used to explain the purpose of the custom rule.

fileLocation.title: File Location
fileLocation.description: Specify full path location of the file.

allowMsisdnChange.description: Specify whether MSISDN change is allowed or not.
allowMsisdnChange.definition: MSISDN change determines whether the plans and features can continue or not.

transferFreebees.description: Specify whether add-on freebees are transferred to the new MSISDN or lost.
transferFreebees.definition: Unused freebees can be transfer to the new MSISDN or removed.

contractPolicy.description: Specify whether the contract can be transferred to the new MSISDN or not.

allowOwnerTransfer.description: Specify whether ownership transfer is allowed or not.
allowOwnerTransfer.definition: Ownership transfer (AKA subscribership transfer) determines whether the owner of an account (MSISDN) can be changed or not.

ownerTransferCharge.title: Owner Transfer Charge
ownerTransferCharge.description: Specify charges to be applied due.
ownerTransferCharge.definition: Charge can be applied due to Ownership transfer action.

dueAmount.title: Due Amount
dueAmount.description: Specify how to handle amount due.
dueAmount.definition: Existing unsettled amount due need to be handled properly when for the ownership transfer to occur correctly.

plansPolicy.title: Plans Policy
plansPolicy.description: Specify effect of the ownership transfer on the base plan and add-ons.
plansPolicy.definition: Owner of the account can be changed after the current owner pays the charges. However, the current features might continue to live for next owner or could be terminated.
enum: Transfer Base Plan and Cease Add-ons (Exit Policy Applied)
Cease Base Plan and Add-ons (Exit Policy Applied)

transferFreebees.description: Specify whether add-on freebees are transferred to the new owner or kept with original owner.
transferFreebees.definition: Unused freebees can be transfer to the new owner or remain with the original owner.

contractPolicy.title: Contract Policy
contractPolicy.description: Specify whether the contract can be transferred to the new owner or not.
contractPolicy.definition: Contract on the original owner may or may not be transferred to the new owner.

accountName.title: Account Name
accountName.definition: Account name must be a unique name that should not be repeated in any service.

accountType.title: Account Type
accountType.definition: Account Type defines where the charges are posted. Usually accounts are isolated so the individuals are responsible for the charges. For Linked Account, the customer enjoys the benefits but the charges are posted to the corporate account (sometimes called as Dummy account).

linkedAccounts.title: Linked Accounts
linkedAccounts.description: Specify number of accounts that can be linked to this account.
linkedAccounts.definition: In case of Master account, the number of allowed linked account can be limited. 0 means no limit.

redundantLimit.title: Redundant Limit
redundantLimit.description: Specify number of this same account that a user can subscribe.
redundantLimit.definition: Multiple accounts of same type can be restricted to a specific number. 0 means no limit. [REMOVE THIS. Already captured in base plan]

segmentsEligibility.title: Segments Eligibility
segmentsEligibility.description: Specify segments allowed to subscribe to the account.
segmentsEligibility.definition: Customers are segmented according to Sales. Certain customer segments can be allowed to get this service.

ownershipTransfer.title: Ownership Transfer
ownershipTransfer.description: Specify effect of the ownership transfer on the base plan and add-ons.
ownershipTransfer.definition: Owner of the account can be changed after the current owner pays the charges. However, the current features might continue to live for next owner or could be terminated.
enum: Keep Base Plan and Cease Add-ons

prorateFreebees.title: Prorate Freebees
prorateFreebees.description: Specify whether freebees should be pro-rated on plan reactivation.
prorateFreebees.definition: Upon reactivation, freebees can provided in full or pro-rated.

proratePeriodicCharge.title: Prorate Periodic Charge
proratePeriodicCharge.description: Specify whether periodic rental charges should be pro-rated on plan reactivation.
proratePeriodicCharge.definition: Upon reactivation, rental charges can be full or pro-rated.

sendNotification.title: Send Notification
sendNotification.description: Specify whether notification about reactivation should be send to the customer.
sendNotification.definition: Customer can get notification that reactivation is started.

notificationChannel.title: Notification Channel
notificationChannel.description: Specify channels for sending notifications to the customer.
notificationChannel.definition: Customer can get notification about reactivation in different channels.

notificationText.title: Notification Text
notificationText.description: Specify notification message that will be send to the customer.
notificationText.definition: Customer can get notification message detailing affected services and rules applied due to reactivation.

suspensionPeriod.title: Suspension Period
suspensionPeriod.description: Specify period of suspension before full deactivation occurs.
suspensionPeriod.definition: For postpaid plans, customer will be in Temporary Out of Service Status (TOSS) where some services might be disabled.

freebees.title: Freebees
freebees.description: Specify action on the freebees when full suspension occurs.
freebees.definition: During full suspension, customer can continue enjoying freebees or freebees will be exhausted.

outOfBundle.title: Out-of-Bundle
outOfBundle.description: Specify action on the out-of-bundle calls, messages, and data when full suspension occurs.
outOfBundle.definition: During full suspension, customer can be allowed or disabled to use rated (tariff) outgoing calls, messages, and data.

receiveIncoming.title: Receive Incoming
receiveIncoming.description: Specify action on the receiving calls or messages when full suspension occurs.
receiveIncoming.definition: During full suspension, customer can be allowed or disabled to use rated (tariff) incoming calls and messages.

periodicCharge.title: Periodic Charge
periodicCharge.description: Specify action on the rentals when full suspension occurs.
periodicCharge.definition: During full suspension, customer can be charged for the periodic rentals or this charge is stopped.

contractPeriod.title: Contract Period
contractPeriod.description: Specify action on the contract when full suspension occurs.
contractPeriod.definition: During full suspension, contract period can continue, paused, or terminated with exit policy.

sendNotification.title: Send Notification
sendNotification.description: Specify whether notification about full suspension should be send to the customer.
sendNotification.definition: Customer can get notification that full suspension is started.

notificationChannel.title: Notification Channel
notificationChannel.description: Specify channels for sending notifications to the customer.
notificationChannel.definition: Customer can get notification about full suspension in different channels.

notificationText.title: Notification Text
notificationText.description: Specify notification message that will be send to the customer.
notificationText.definition: Customer can get notification message detailing affected services and rules applied due to full suspension.

notes.title: Notes
notes.description: Enter additional rules or information here.
notes.definition: Additional rules or information on Suspension Full can be added here.

gracePeriod.title: Grace Period
gracePeriod.description: Specify period of non-payment before partial suspension occurs.
gracePeriod.definition: For postpaid plans, customer gets amount due by end of the month. The grace period allows customer to continue using the service before the amount is collected.

suspensionPeriod.title: Suspension Period
suspensionPeriod.description: Specify period of suspension before full deactivation occurs.
suspensionPeriod.definition: For postpaid plans, customer will be in Temporary Out of Service Status (TOSS) where some services might be disabled.

freebees.title: Freebees
freebees.description: Specify action on the freebees when partial suspension occurs.
freebees.definition: During partial suspension, customer can continue enjoying freebees or freebees will be exhausted.

outOfBundle.title: Out-of-Bundle
outOfBundle.description: Specify action on the out-of-bundle calls, messages, and data when partial suspension occurs.
outOfBundle.definition: During partial suspension, customer can be allowed or disabled to use rated (tariff) outgoing calls, messages, and data.

receiveIncoming.title: Receive Incoming
receiveIncoming.description: Specify action on the receiving calls or messages when partial suspension occurs.
receiveIncoming.definition: During partial suspension, customer can be allowed or disabled to use rated (tariff) incoming calls and messages.

periodicCharge.title: Periodic Charge
periodicCharge.description: Specify action on the rentals when partial suspension occurs.
periodicCharge.definition: During partial suspension, customer can be charged for the periodic rentals or this charge is stopped.

contractPeriod.title: Contract Period
contractPeriod.description: Specify action on the contract when partial suspension occurs.
contractPeriod.definition: During partial suspension, contract period can continue, paused, or terminated with exit policy.

sendNotification.title: Send Notification
sendNotification.description: Specify whether notification about partial suspension should be send to the customer.
sendNotification.definition: Customer can get notification that partial suspension is started.

notificationChannel.title: Notification Channel
notificationChannel.description: Specify channels for sending notifications to the customer.
notificationChannel.definition: Customer can get notification about partial suspension in different channels.

notificationText.title: Notification Text
notificationText.description: Specify notification message that will be send to the customer.
notificationText.definition: Customer can get notification message detailing affected services and rules applied due to partial suspension.

notes.title: Notes
notes.description: Enter additional rules or information here.
notes.definition: Additional rules or information on Suspension Partial can be added here.

appendixName.title: Appendix Name
appendixName.description: Specify name of the Appendix chapter.
appendixName.definition: This name will be use in the appendix chapter name.

appendixDescription.title: Appendix Description
appendixDescription.description: Specify description of the Appendix chapter.
appendixDescription.definition: The description text will be used in the beginning of the appendix chapter.

filenamePath.title: Filename Path
filenamePath.description: Specify relative or full path of the file name.
filenamePath.definition: Relative or full path of the filename can be provided.

insertMethod.title: Insert Method
insertMethod.description: Specify whether to embed the file or extract its contents.
insertMethod.definition: A file can be embeded in the document or its contents can be copied to the document.

notes.title: Notes
notes.description: Enter additional rules or information here.
notes.definition: Additional rules or information on Additional Info can be added here.

durationType.title: Duration Type
durationType.description: Specify type of duration as day, week, month, quarter, or year.
durationType.definition: Change trigger can be specified after a duration type which can be after day(s), week(s), month(s), quarter(s), or year(s).

durationAmount.title: Duration Amount
durationAmount.definition: Change can be specified to trigger after certain amount of duration type.

notes.title: Notes
notes.description: Enter additional rules or information here.
notes.definition: Additional rules or information on Change After can be added here.

mutuallyExclusiveWith.title: Mutually Exclusive With
mutuallyExclusiveWith.description: Specify other component or property names to be mutually exclusive with.
mutuallyExclusiveWith.definition: Other property can be mutually exclusively where one of them can exist at any given time but not both.

notes.title: Notes

durationType.title: Duration Type

durationType.definition: Remove trigger can be specified after a duration type which can be after day(s), week(s), month(s), quarter(s), or year(s).

durationAmount.title: Duration Amount
durationAmount.definition: Remove can be specified to trigger after certain amount of duration type.

notes.title: Notes

fullName.title: Full Name
fullName.description: Specify full name of the stakeholder.
fullName.definition: Stakeholder full name contains first name and last name. Ideally it should match the name as displayed in Outlook email.

departmentCode.title: Department Code
departmentCode.description: Specify abbreviation of the stakeholder department and section.
departmentCode.definition: Department code is the abbreviation letters of the department.

roleInProject.title: Role In Project
roleInProject.description: Specify role of the stakeholder in the project.

involvement.title: Involvement
involvement.description: Specify the stakeholder involvement in the project is primary or secondary.

position.title: Position
position.description: Specify job title of the stakeholder.
position.definition: Job title of the stakeholder specifies the designation. Examples: Engineer, Manager, and Director.

officePhone.title: Office Phone
officePhone.description: Specify office telephone number of the stakeholder.

mobilePhone.title: Mobile Phone
mobilePhone.description: Specify mobile phone of the stakeholder.

floor.title: Floor
floor.description: Specify floor where the stakeholder is located.

building.title: Building
building.description: Specify building where the stakeholder is located.

city.title: City
city.description: Specify city where the stakeholder is located.

country.title: Country
country.description: Specify country where the stakeholder is located.

fullAddress.title: Full Address
fullAddress.description: Specify full address of the stakeholder.

managerName.title: Manager Name
managerName.description: Specify full name of the manager of the stakeholder.

notes.title: Notes

notes.definition: Additional requirements on Stakeholder property can be added here.

productOwner.title: Product Owner
productOwner.description: Specify name of the SPOC from Product Marketing for this project.
productOwner.definition: Product Owner defines the business rules regarding the product.

productDeveloper.title: Product Developer
productDeveloper.description: Specify name of the SPOC from Product Development for this project.
productDeveloper.definition: Product Developer ensures business rules are complete and captured correctly.

notes.title: Notes
notes.description: Enter additional rules or information here.
notes.definition: Additional rules or information on Contacts can be added here.

projectName.title: Project Name
projectName.definition: Name of the project is unique across the organization and it is very concise yet its scope can be easily inferred.

projectId.title: Project ID
projectId.definition: Project ID is tracked in Portfolio and Project Management (PPM) tool.

projectNature.title: Project Nature
projectNature.definition: Project nature can be either to create a new product where existing customers will not be impacted or to modify an existing product where existing customers will be impacted.

projectSummary.title: Project Summary
projectSummary.description: Specify brief description of the project.
projectSummary.definition: Short description of the project that gives high level abstraction about its goals.

startDate.title: Start Date
startDate.description: Specify target start date of the project.
startDate.definition: The expected or agreed start date of the project.

completionDate.title: Completion Date
completionDate.description: Specify target completion date of the project.
completionDate.definition: The expected or agreed completion date of the project.

notes.title: Notes
notes.description: Enter additional rules or information here.
notes.definition: Additional rules or information on Project can be added here.

basePlanName.title: Base Plan Name
basePlanName.definition: Base plan name must be a unique name that should not be repeated in any service. Base plan name should include flavor name so it is distinctively identifiable.

serviceClass.title: Service Class
serviceClass.definition: Service class specifies the main category of the base plan.

workScope.title: Work Scope
workScope.description: Specify whether to create a new base plan or modify an existing base plan.
workScope.definition: Modifying an existing base plan will affect all existing customers who are using it. Creating a new base plan will not impact existing customers.

allowedSegments.title: Allowed Segments
allowedSegments.description: Specify segments allowed to subscribe to the plan.
allowedSegments.definition: Certain customer categories or segments can be allowed to subscribe to this plan.

allowVoice.title: Allow Voice
allowVoice.description: Specify whether voice call is enabled or not.
allowVoice.definition: Voice call service can be enabled or disabled for a base plan. Most of the base plans will have Voice service enabled except for Data only plans. Note if this is set to Disabled, then no "Call Freebees" or "Call Tariff" should be allowed to be added to the Component.

allowVideo.title: Allow Video
allowVideo.description: Specify whether video call is enabled or not.
allowVideo.definition: Video service can be enabled or disabled for a base plan. Most of the base plans will have Video service enabled even for Data only plans. Note if this is set to Disabled, then no video "Call Freebees" or video "Call Usage" should be allowed to be added to the Component.

allowSms.title: Allow SMS
allowSms.description: Specify whether SMS message is enabled or not.
allowSms.definition: Messaging service can be enabled or disabled for a base plan. Most of the base plans will have Messaging service enabled even for Data only plans. Note if this is set to Disabled, then no SMS "Message Freebees" or SMS "Message Tariff" should be allowed to be added to the Component.

allowMms.title: Allow MMS
allowMms.description: Specify whether MMS message is enabled or not.
allowMms.definition: Messaging service can be enabled or disabled for a base plan. Most of the base plans will have Messaging service enabled even for Data only plans. Note if this is set to Disabled, then no MMS "Message Freebees" or MMS "Message Tariff" should be allowed to be added to the Component.

allowData.title: Allow Data
allowData.description: Specify whether Data is enabled or not.
allowData.definition: Data service can be enabled or disabled for a base plan. Most of the base plans will have Data enabled. Note if this is set to Disabled, then no "Data Freebees" or "Data Tariff" should be allowed to be added to the Component.

allowStd.title: Allow STD
allowStd.description: Specify whether local call, message, and data are enabled or not.

allowCug.title: Allow CUG
allowCug.description: Specify whether group call, message, and data are enabled or not.

allowIdd.title: Allow IDD
allowIdd.description: Specify whether international call, message, and data are enabled or not.

allowIcr.title: Allow ICR
allowIcr.description: Specify whether incoming call, message, and data are enabled or not.
allowIcr.definition: Incoming roaming usages are mostly allowed.

allowOgr.title: Allow OGR
allowOgr.description: Specify whether outgoing call, message, and data are enabled or not.
allowOgr.definition: Outgoing roaming usages are mostly allowed.

allowLte.title: Allow LTE
allowLte.description: Specify whether 4G Data capability is enabled or not.

allowUbt.title: Allow UBT
allowUbt.description: Specify whether User (National) Balance Transfer is enable or not.
allowUbt.definition: A subscriber can transfer a credit to another user locally. Balance transfer can happen via USSD code.

allowIbt.title: Allow IBT
allowIbt.description: Specify whether International Balance Transfer is enabled or not.
allowIbt.definition: A subscriber can transfer a credit to another user internationally. Balance transfer can happen via USSD code.

preActivateRoaming.title: Pre-activate Roaming
preActivateRoaming.description: Specify whether roaming service should be pre-activated automatically or not.
preActivateRoaming.definition: Roaming service should be enabled in order to make roaming usages (Call, Message, or Data). Note there are also different caps for roaming usage which are configurable per customer if they meet the cap criteria.

paymentType.title: Payment Type
paymentType.description: Specify type of the base plan payment: Prepaid/Postpaid.
paymentType.definition: A base plan can be Prepaid or Postpaid. Selecting this option has multiple consequences including but not limited to: Day of Monthly Charge, Day of Freebees Refill, Standard Call Usage Charge, and Invoice. Note that a Prepaid account can exist inside Postpaid forming a structure known as Hybrid account.

eligibleSpecialNumber.title: Eligible Special Number
eligibleSpecialNumber.description: Specify format of the special number that are eligible by this base plan.
eligibleSpecialNumber.definition: A subscriber can be eligible for certain special number formats or categories as part of the base plan offer. --Example of special number format: 050-1234XXX. Example of special number categories: Silver Special Numbers or Diamond Special Numbers.

maxAllowedPlans.title: Max Allowed Plans
maxAllowedPlans.description: Specify number of this same add-on that a user can subscribe.
maxAllowedPlans.definition: Multiple base plan of same type can be restricted to a specific number. If 0 is entered, then customer can get any number of this base plan.

prohibitedAddOns.title: Prohibited Add-ons
prohibitedAddOns.description: Specify add-ons that are prohibited on this base plan.
prohibitedAddOns.definition: Some add-ons are not be allowed to be provisioned to satisfy the business case.

requiredRoleName.title: Required Role Name
requiredRoleName.description: Specify required role names for the CRM user to grant access.
requiredRoleName.definition: Role name can be used to restrict the CRM users which are allowed to see and provision the base plan.

launchDate.title: Launch Date
launchDate.description: Specify launch date of the base plan.
launchDate.definition: Date of the official launch of the plan for sale.

withdrawalDate.title: Withdrawal Date
withdrawalDate.description: Specify discontinuation date of the base plan.
withdrawalDate.definition: Date of stopping the plan for sale.

primaryPackageCode.title: Primary Package Code
primaryPackageCode.definition: Primary Package Code is used in CBCM screen to provision a base service to a customer.

packageCode.title: Package Code
packageCode.description: Specify CBCM Package Code for the base plan.
packageCode.definition: Package Code is used in CBCM screen to provision a service for a customer.

packageDescription.title: Package Description
packageDescription.description: Specify CBCM Package Description for the base plan.
packageDescription.definition: Every package has a description to help the CBCM user understands the purpose of the service.

rateplanCode.title: Rateplan Code
rateplanCode.description: Specify CBCM Rateplan Code for the base plan.
rateplanCode.definition: Rateplan Code is used in CBCM screen to provision a service for a customer.

rateplanDescription.title: Rateplan Description
rateplanDescription.description: Specify CBCM Rateplan Description for the base plan.
rateplanDescription.definition: Every rateplan has a description to help the CBCM user understands the purpose of the service.

glCode.title: GL Code
glCode.description: Specify Finance GL code for the rateplan.
glCode.definition: GL (General Ledger) Code is used by Finance for revenue bookings.

systemOfferedDate.title: System Offered Date
systemOfferedDate.description: Specify date when the rateplan was opened for sale.
systemOfferedDate.definition: Date of the rateplan activated in CBCM.

systemClosureDate.title: System Closure Date
systemClosureDate.description: Specify date when the rateplan was closed for sale.
systemClosureDate.definition: Date of the rateplan deactivated in CBCM.

notes.title: Notes
notes.description: Enter additional rules or information here.
notes.definition: Additional requirements on Base Plan property can be added here.

addOnName.title: Add-on Name
addOnName.definition: Add-on name must be a unique name that should not be repeated in any service. Add-on name should include flavor name so it is distinctively identifiable.

addOnScope.title: Add-on Scope
addOnScope.definition: From service construction point of view, there are two kinds of add-ons: add-on limited to specific base plans (Add-on) and add-on open to all base plans (Value Added Service).

allowedSegments.title: Allowed Segments
allowedSegments.description: Specify segments allowed to subscribe to the plan.
allowedSegments.definition: Certain customer categories or segments can be allowed to subscribe to this plan.

permittedProductGroups.title: Permitted Product Groups
permittedProductGroups.description: Specify product groups that are allowed by this add-on.
permittedProductGroups.definition: Add-on can be limited to specific set of Product Groups.

permittedServices.title: Permitted Services
permittedServices.description: Specify services that are allowed by this add-on.
permittedServices.definition: Add-on can be limited to specific set of Services or all the services within selected Product Groups.

permittedBasePlans.title: Permitted Base Plans
permittedBasePlans.description: Specify base plan flavors that are allowed by this add-on.
permittedBasePlans.definition: Add-on can be limited to specific set of Base Plan flavors or all the Base Plan flavors within selected Services.

requiredAddOns.title: Required Add-ons
requiredAddOns.description: Specify add-ons that are required by this add-on.
requiredAddOns.definition: These are pre-requisited whereby an add-on cannot be provisioned unless other add-on is provisioned first. Example of this is the discounted Device add-on that can be given only when there is a Data add-on.

prohibitedAddOns.title: Prohibited Add-ons
prohibitedAddOns.description: Specify add-ons that are restricted to be provisioned with this add-on.
prohibitedAddOns.definition: Some add-ons are not be allowed to be provisioned to satisfy the business case.

basePlanCoupling.title: Base Plan Coupling
basePlanCoupling.description: Specify whether change flavor of base plan should change the add-on flavor.
basePlanCoupling.definition: If the add-on is restricted to a specific base plan and "Base Plan Coupling" is enabled, the add-on flavor will be changed when the base plan flavor is changed during upgrade/downgrade. For example, a Device Silver add-on which is restricted to Silver base plan will be changed automatically to Device Gold add-on when the base plan is upgraded to Gold flavor.

maxAllowedAddOns.title: Max Allowed Add-ons
maxAllowedAddOns.description: Specify number of this same add-on that a user can subscribe.
maxAllowedAddOns.definition: Multiple add-ons of same type can be restricted to a specific number. If 0 is entered, then customer can get any number of this add-on.

allowSameTypeAddOns.title: Allow Same Type Add-ons
allowSameTypeAddOns.description: Specify whether add-ons of same type but different amount are allowed.
allowSameTypeAddOns.definition: Add-ons of same type but different amount can be restricted so that a customer should select one particular add-on within same type because of different price calculations. On the other hand, this restriction can be lifted so that a customer can mix add-ons of different amounts of same type because the charges for each add-on is paid individually.

requiredRoleName.title: Required Role Name
requiredRoleName.description: Specify required role names for the CRM user to grant access.
requiredRoleName.definition: Role name can be used to restrict the CRM users which are allowed to see and provision the base plan.

launchDate.title: Launch Date
launchDate.description: Specify launch date of the add-on.
launchDate.definition: Date of the official launch of the plan for sale.

withdrawalDate.title: Withdrawal Date
withdrawalDate.description: Specify discontinuation date of the add-on.
withdrawalDate.definition: Date of stopping the plan for sale.

packageCode.title: Package Code
packageCode.description: Specify CBCM Package Code for the add-on.
packageCode.definition: Package Code is used in CBCM screen to provision a service for a customer.

packageDescription.title: Package Description
packageDescription.description: Specify CBCM Package Description for the add-on.
packageDescription.definition: Every package has a description to help the CBCM user understands the purpose of the service.

rateplanCode.title: Rateplan Code
rateplanCode.description: Specify CBCM Rateplan Code for the add-on.
rateplanCode.definition: Rateplan Code is used in CBCM screen to provision a service for a customer.

rateplanDescription.title: Rateplan Description
rateplanDescription.description: Specify CBCM Rateplan Description for the add-on.
rateplanDescription.definition: Every rateplan has a description to help the CBCM user understands the purpose of the service.

glCode.title: GL Code
glCode.description: Specify Finance GL code for the rateplan.
glCode.definition: GL (General Ledger) Code is used by Finance for revenue bookings.

systemOfferedDate.title: System Offered Date
systemOfferedDate.description: Specify date when the rateplan was opened for sale.
systemOfferedDate.definition: Date of the rateplan activated in CBCM.

systemClosureDate.title: System Closure Date
systemClosureDate.description: Specify date when the rateplan was closed for sale.
systemClosureDate.definition: Date of the rateplan deactivated in CBCM.

notes.title: Notes
notes.description: Enter additional information here.
notes.definition: Additional requirements on Add-on property can be added here.

eligibleNumberFormat.title: Eligible Number Format
eligibleNumberFormat.description: Specify eligible format of the special MSISDN number.
eligibleNumberFormat.definition: Special MSISDN numbers of certain format can be given to the subscriber. --For example, "050 1234 ???" will allow the customer to take numbers like 050 1234 825, 050 1234 343, and 050 1234 888.

eligibleNumberCategory.title: Eligible Number Category
eligibleNumberCategory.description: Specify eligible category of the special MSISDN number.
eligibleNumberCategory.definition: Special MSISDN numbers of certain category can be given to the subscriber.

notes.title: Notes
notes.description: Enter additional rules or information here.
notes.definition: Additional rules or information on MSISDN can be added here.

simCardName.title: SIM Card Name
simCardName.description: Specify name of the SIM card.

firstSimCharge.title: First SIM Charge
firstSimCharge.description: Specify one-time charge of the first SIM card.

firstSimMonthlyCharge.title: First SIM Monthly Charge
firstSimMonthlyCharge.description: Specify monthly charge of the first SIM card.

extraSimCharge.title: Extra SIM Charge
extraSimCharge.description: Specify one-time charge of each additional SIM card.

extraSimMonthlyCharge.title: Extra SIM Monthly Charge
extraSimMonthlyCharge.description: Specify monthly charge of each additional SIM card.

replacementSimCharge.title: Replacement SIM Charge
replacementSimCharge.description: Specify one-time charge of each additional SIM card.

notes.title: Notes
notes.description: Enter additional rules or information here.
notes.definition: Additional rules or information on SIM Card can be added here.

nature.title: Nature
nature.definition: STD is for national calls. CUG is for calls within same group (Community ID). IDD is for international calls. ICR is for incoming roaming calls. OGR is for outgoing roaming calls. FLEXI is any combination of STD, CUG, IDD, ICR, and OGR.

technology.title: Technology
technology.description: Specify technology type of the call.
technology.definition: Call freebees can be configured for Voice calls or Video calls. Note that Voice calls and Video calls are based on "circuit switching" which means the connection line between the caller and the called person is fully occupied by this call and not shared with other calls (unlike "packet switching" which is IP based and allows multiple calls to share the same line). Most of the calls are Voice calls and there are very less calls based on Video. Video calls are not popular because of limited handsets support, no freebees offers on Video calls, and customer awareness.

freebeesUnit.title: Freebees Unit
freebeesUnit.definition: Freebees unit specifies what kind of usage that should be considered as freebees. If freebees consumption is based on a specific Charge amount, then usage charges up to this amount will not billed to the customer. If freebees consumption is based on a specific Duration amount, then usage charges up to this period will not billed to the customer.

freebeesAmount.title: Freebees Amount
freebeesAmount.description: Specify amount of freebees to offer.
freebeesAmount.definition: The amount of call freebees to offer to the customer and it will be treated as free duration period or free charge amount.

unitPulse.title: Unit Pulse
unitPulse.description: Specify charging pulse of the call.
unitPulse.definition: The charging pulse (also known as charging metric) specifies how to calculate the full call duration in terms of multiples of minimum durations. If the charging pulse is defined as "Per Minute", then any call duration will be rounded up to minutes. For example, a call duration of 40 seconds is considered as 1 minute and a call duration of 10 minutes and 5 seconds is considered as 11 minutes. In case of "Per Second" charging pulse, then any call duration will be rounded up to seconds. Usually the charging pules for freebees call is set to "Per Minute".

networkLines.title: Network Lines
networkLines.description: Specify network categories for the call.
networkLines.definition: Network lines determine whether freebees calls to be restricted of Mobile network only, Fixed network only, or any network. This is useful to be able to make things like freebees to fixed lines only. Note that further restriction can be done by configuring "Direction" attribute.

maxDestinations.title: Max Destinations
maxDestinations.description: Specify how many numbers allowed in the list of destination numbers.
maxDestinations.definition: List of F&F distination numbers can be restricted to a limited numbers.

maxDestinationChanges.title: Max Destination Changes
maxDestinationChanges.description: Specify maximum changes allowed per month to the list of destination numbers.
maxDestinationChanges.definition: Changes to list of F&F destination numbers can be restricte to certain times per month. When the number of changes per month is reached, the next change cannot happen till next month.

destinationsAssignment.title: Destinations Assignment
destinationsAssignment.description: Specify how the list of destination numbers can be defined.
destinationsAssignment.definition: List of F&F distination numbers can be defined and changed by Etisalat sales or it can be defined and changed by the customer or both. Authorized Etisalat users can use CRM for updating the list. Customer can send SMS message for updating this list.

permittedSources.title: Permitted Sources
permittedSources.definition: Source initiators can be restricted to certain list so that any communication to the customer from initiators outside the list is not allowed.

prohibitedSources.title: Prohibited Sources
prohibitedSources.definition: Source initiators can be blocked to certain list so that any communication to the customer from initiators in the list is not allowed.

permittedDestinations.title: Permitted Destinations
permittedDestinations.definition: Target destinations can be restricted to certain list so that any communication attempt by the customer on destinations outside the list is not allowed.

prohibitedDestinations.title: Prohibited Destinations
prohibitedDestinations.definition: Target destinations can be blocked to certain list so that any communication attempt by the customer on destinations in the list is not allowed.

freebeesPriority.title: Freebees Priority
freebeesPriority.description: Specify priority with respect to other call freebees.
freebeesPriority.definition: Priority specifies when the freebees consumption should happen when there are other call freebees exist on the same account.

freebeesTrigger.title: Freebees Trigger
freebeesTrigger.description: Specify when the freebees start date should begin.
freebeesTrigger.definition: Freebees Start defines when the freebees consumption timer should begin. On Subscription causes the freebees timer to start immediately whether a customer made usages or not. On First Usage will trigger the Freebees timer only when the customer makes any usage. Usually for periodic freebees, this is set to On Subscription. However, for one-time freebees, this selection has a significant difference.

freebeesDurationType.title: Freebees Duration Type
freebeesDurationType.description: Specify type of duration as day, week, month, quarter, or year.
freebeesDurationType.definition: Freebees can last based on certain duration type which can be day(s), week(s), month(s), quarter(s), or year(s).

freebeesDuration.title: Freebees Duration
freebeesDuration.definition: Freebees can be specified to last for certain amount of duration type.

refillCycle.title: Refill Cycle
refillCycle.description: Specify cycles which the freebees should be refilled.
refillCycle.definition: Refill Cycles determines the behavior of freebees when the Duration is completed. Usually freebees is provided as one-time only or as auto-renew. Monthly auto-renew method behaves differently on Prepaid than on Postpaid. On Prepaid, the start of each cycle is the same day of the month when the first cycle was activated. For Postpaid, the start of each cycle is the first day of the month. That's why prorate happens on first month when the base plan is Postpaid.

carryOverCycles.title: Carry-Over Cycles
carryOverCycles.description: Specify grace period that the freebees should continue to exist.
carryOverCycles.definition: Carry-Over Cycles determines whether to add the unused freebees to the next freebees cycle(s) or remove the unused freebees at the end of the cycle. For example, if a customer has a 100 min monthly freebees and 50 min were consumed only by the end of the month and Carry-Over is allowed, then customer will get 150 min in the next month.

freebeesCap.title: Freebees Cap
freebeesCap.description: Specify capping rule when all freebees are consumed.
freebeesCap.definition: "Freebees Cap" determines whether out-of-bundle charge is allowed after full consumption of freebees amount or not. Most of Freebees allow OOB charge. However, for Data Freebees, the customer can select and change any time whether this should be set to Soft Cap or Hard Cap.

prorateOnSubscribe.title: Prorate on Subscribe
prorateOnSubscribe.description: Specify whether the freebees should be prorated based on the day of the month when subscription or upgrade/downgrade happens.
prorateOnSubscribe.definition: Usually, freebees are prorated when the refill is periodic and the base plan is Postpaid. Note that proration of the charge should match the freebees.

prorateOnExit.title: Prorate on Exit
prorateOnExit.description: Specify whether the freebees should be prorated based on the day of the month when exit happens.
prorateOnExit.definition: In most cases, freebees are not prorated on exit which means the unused freebees will continue till end of the cycle.

outOfBundleCharge.title: Out-of-Bundle Charge
outOfBundleCharge.description: Specify out-of-bundle charge of the call.
outOfBundleCharge.definition: The monetary amount that should be charged to customer against each usage pulse. This will be either AED X per Second or AED X per Minute.

outOfBundlePulse.title: Out-of-Bundle Pulse
outOfBundlePulse.description: Specify charging pulse of the call.
outOfBundlePulse.definition: The charging pulse (also known as charging metric) specifies how to calculate the full call duration in terms of multiples of minimum durations. If the charging pulse is defined as "Per Minute", then any call duration will be rounded up to minutes. For example, a call duration of 40 seconds is considered as 1 minute and a call duration of 10 minutes and 5 seconds is considered as 11 minutes. In case of "Per Second" charging pulse, then any call duration will be rounded up to seconds. Usually the charging pules for freebees call is set to "Per Minute".

notes.title: Notes
notes.description: Enter additional rules or information here.
notes.definition: Additional rules or information on Call Freebees can be added here.

nature.title: Nature
nature.definition: STD is for national calls. CUG is for calls within same group (Community ID). IDD is for international calls. ICR is for incoming roaming calls. OGR is for outgoing roaming calls. FLEXI is any combination of STD, CUG, IDD, ICR, and OGR.

technology.title: Technology
technology.description: Specify technology type of the call.
technology.definition: Call Tariff can be configured for Voice calls or Video calls. Note that Voice calls and Video calls are based on "circuit switching" which means the connection line between the caller and the called person is fully occupied by this call and not shared with other calls (unlike "packet switching" which is IP based and allows multiple calls to share the same line). Most of the calls are Voice calls and there are very less calls based on Video. Video calls are not popular because of limited handsets support, no freebees offers on Video calls, and customer awareness.

tariffCharge.title: Tariff Charge
tariffCharge.description: Specify tariff charge of the call.
tariffCharge.definition: The monetary amount that should be charged to customer against each usage pulse. This will be either AED X per Second or AED X per Minute.

setupCharge.title: Setup Charge
setupCharge.description: Specify setup charge of the call.
setupCharge.definition: The monetary amount that should be charged to customer against each call regardless of its duration.

unitPulse.title: Unit Pulse
unitPulse.description: Specify charging pulse of the call.
unitPulse.definition: The charging pulse (also known as charging metric) specifies how to calculate the full call duration in terms of multiples of minimum durations. If the charging pulse is defined as "Per Minute", then any call duration will be rounded up to minutes. For example, a call duration of 40 seconds is considered as 1 minute and a call duration of 10 minutes and 5 seconds is considered as 11 minutes. In case of "Per Second" charging pulse, then any call duration will be rounded up to seconds. Usually the charging pules for tariff call is set to "Per Second".

networkLines.title: Network Lines
networkLines.description: Specify network categories for the call.
networkLines.definition: Network lines determine whether freebees calls to be restricted of Mobile network only, Fixed network only, or any network. This is useful to be able to make things like freebees to fixed lines only. Note that further restriction can be done by configuring "Direction" attribute.

maxDestinations.title: Max Destinations
maxDestinations.description: Specify how many numbers allowed in the list of destination numbers.
maxDestinations.definition: List of F&F distination numbers can be restricted to a limited numbers.

maxDestinationChanges.title: Max Destination Changes
maxDestinationChanges.description: Specify maximum changes allowed per month to the list of destination numbers.
maxDestinationChanges.definition: Changes to list of F&F destination numbers can be restricte to certain times per month. When the number of changes per month is reached, the next change cannot happen till next month.

destinationsAssignment.title: Destinations Assignment
destinationsAssignment.description: Specify how the list of destination numbers can be defined.
destinationsAssignment.definition: List of F&F distination numbers can be defined and changed by Etisalat sales or it can be defined and changed by the customer or both. Authorized Etisalat users can use CRM for updating the list. Customer can send SMS message for updating this list.

permittedSources.title: Permitted Sources
permittedSources.definition: Source initiators can be restricted to certain list so that any communication to the customer from initiators outside the list is not allowed.

prohibitedSources.title: Prohibited Sources
prohibitedSources.definition: Source initiators can be blocked to certain list so that any communication to the customer from initiators in the list is not allowed.

permittedDestinations.title: Permitted Destinations
permittedDestinations.definition: Target destinations can be restricted to certain list so that any communication attempt by the customer on destinations outside the list is not allowed.

prohibitedDestinations.title: Prohibited Destinations
prohibitedDestinations.definition: Target destinations can be blocked to certain list so that any communication attempt by the customer on destinations in the list is not allowed.

allowChargeSponsor.title: Allow Charge Sponsor
allowChargeSponsor.description: Specify whether the charge should be billed against master account or individual account.
allowChargeSponsor.definition: Usually the individual is responsible of the usage charges. However, the charges can be posted to the family head or the company which the account is linked to it.

billingWords.title: Billing Words
billingWords.description: Specify text that appears in the bill for this charge.
billingWords.definition: Billing words specify the text that should appear in the invoice which will inform the customer about the type of this usage charges.

notes.title: Notes
notes.description: Enter additional information here.
notes.definition: Additional requirements on Call Tariff property can be added here.

nature.title: Nature
nature.definition: STD is for national messages. CUG is for messages within same group (Community ID). IDD is for international messages. ICR is for incoming roaming messages. OGR is for outgoing roaming messages. FLEXI is any combination of STD, CUG, IDD, ICR, and OGR.

technology.title: Technology
technology.description: Specify technology type of the message.
technology.definition: Message freebees can be configured for SMS messages or for MMS messages.

freebeesUnit.title: Freebees Unit
freebeesUnit.definition: Freebees unit specifies what kind of usage that should be considered as freebees. If freebees consumption is based on a specific Charge amount, then usage charges up to this amount will not billed to the customer. If freebees consumption is based on a specific Duration amount, then usage charges up to this period will not billed to the customer.

freebeesAmount.title: Freebees Amount
freebeesAmount.description: Specify amount of freebees to offer.
freebeesAmount.definition: The amount of call freebees to offer to the customer and it will be treated as free duration period or free charge amount.

unitPulse.title: Unit Pulse
unitPulse.description: Specify charging pulse of the message.
unitPulse.definition: The charging pulse (also known as charging metric) specifies how to calculate the full call duration in terms of multiples of minimum durations. For example, a call duration of 40 seconds is considered as 1 minute and a call duration of 10 minutes and 5 seconds is considered as 11 minutes. In case of "Per Second" charging pulse, then any call duration will be rounded up to seconds. Usually the charging pules for freebees call is set to "Per Minute".

freebeesPriority.description: Specify priority with respect to other message freebees.
freebeesPriority.definition: Priority specifies when the freebees consumption should happen when there are other call freebees exist on the same account.

freebeesTrigger.title: Freebees Trigger
freebeesTrigger.description: Specify when the freebees start date should begin.
freebeesTrigger.definition: Freebees Start defines when the freebees consumption timer should begin. On Subscription causes the freebees timer to start immediately whether a customer made usages or not. On First Usage will trigger the Freebees timer only when the customer makes any usage. Usually for periodic freebees, this is set to On Subscription. However, for one-time freebees, this selection has a significant difference.

freebeesDurationType.title: Freebees Duration Type
freebeesDurationType.description: Specify type of duration as day, week, month, quarter, or year.
freebeesDurationType.definition: Freebees can last based on certain duration type which can be day(s), week(s), month(s), quarter(s), or year(s).

freebeesDuration.title: Freebees Duration
freebeesDuration.definition: Freebees can be specified to last for certain amount of duration type.

refillCycle.title: Refill Cycle
refillCycle.description: Specify cycles which the freebees should be refilled.
refillCycle.definition: Refill Cycles determines the behavior of freebees when the Duration is completed. Usually freebees is provided as one-time only or as auto-renew. Monthly auto-renew method behaves differently on Prepaid than on Postpaid. On Prepaid, the start of each cycle is the same day of the month when the first cycle was activated. For Postpaid, the start of each cycle is the first day of the month. That's why prorate happens on first month when the base plan is Postpaid.

carryOverCycles.description: Specify grace period that the freebees should continue to exist.
carryOverCycles.definition: Carry-Over Cycles determines whether to add the unused freebees to the next freebees cycle(s) or remove the unused freebees at the end of the cycle. prorateOnSubscribe.description: Specify whether the freebees should be prorated based on the day of the month when subscription or upgrade/downgrade happens.
prorateOnSubscribe.definition: Usually, freebees are prorated when the refill is periodic and the base plan is Postpaid. Note that proration of the charge should match the freebees.

prorateOnExit.title: Prorate on Exit

prorateOnExit.definition: In most cases, freebees are not prorated on exit which means the unused freebees will continue till end of the cycle.

creditPriority.definition: Priority specifies when the credit consumption should happen when there are other call credit exist on the same account.

creditTrigger.title: Credit Trigger
creditTrigger.description: Specify when the credit start date should begin.
creditTrigger.definition: Credit Start defines when the credit consumption timer should begin. On Subscription causes the credit timer to start immediately whether a customer made usages or not. On First Usage will trigger the Credit timer only when the customer makes any usage. Usually for periodic credit, this is set to On Subscription. However, for one-time credit, this selection has a significant difference.

creditDurationType.title: Credit Duration Type
creditDurationType.description: Specify type of duration as day, week, month, quarter, or year.
creditDurationType.definition: Credit can last based on certain duration type which can be day(s), week(s), month(s), quarter(s), or year(s).

creditDuration.title: Credit Duration
creditDuration.definition: Credit can be specified to last for certain amount of duration type.

refillCycle.title: Refill Cycle
refillCycle.description: Specify cycles which the credit should be refilled.
refillCycle.definition: Refill Cycles determines the behavior of credit when the Duration is completed. Usually credit is provided as one-time only or as auto-renew. Monthly auto-renew method behaves differently on Prepaid than on Postpaid. On Prepaid, the start of each cycle is the same day of the month when the first cycle was activated. For Postpaid, the start of each cycle is the first day of the month. That's why prorate happens on first month when the base plan is Postpaid.

carryOverCycles.title: Carry-Over Cycles
carryOverCycles.description: Specify grace period that the credit should continue to exist.
carryOverCycles.definition: Carry-Over Cycles determines whether to add the unused credit to the next credit cycle(s) or remove the unused credit at the end of the cycle. For example, if a customer has a 100 min monthly credit and 50 min were consumed only by the end of the month and Carry-Over is allowed, then customer will get 150 min in the next month.

prorateOnSubscribe.title: Prorate on Subscribe
prorateOnSubscribe.description: Specify whether the credit should be prorated based on the day of the month when subscription or upgrade/downgrade happens.
prorateOnSubscribe.definition: Usually, credit are prorated when the refill is periodic and the base plan is Postpaid. Note that proration of the charge should match the credit.

prorateOnExit.title: Prorate on Exit
prorateOnExit.description: Specify whether the credit should be prorated based on the day of the month when exit happens.
prorateOnExit.definition: In most cases, credit are not prorated on exit which means the unused credit will continue till end of the cycle.

notes.title: Notes
notes.description: Enter additional rules or information here.
notes.definition: Additional rules or information on Usages Credit can be added here.
